meanings.definition: A mechanical figure or contrivance constructed to act as if by its own motive power.
meanings.sent1: The automatons in the clock tower moved mechanically, showing the time to the townspeople.
meanings.sent2: The factory was filled with automatons tirelessly assembling products on the assembly line.
meanings.sent3: The automatons in the haunted house suddenly started dancing, surprising the visitors.
meanings.sent4: The city at night seemed like a sea of automatons, each person lost in their own world.
meanings.sent5: The old toy store was a treasure trove of automatons, each with a unique charm.

meanings.definition: A person or animal that acts in a monotonous, routine manner, without active intelligence.
meanings.sent1: The office seemed full of automatons, each typing away at their desks without a break.
meanings.sent2: The guard dog patrolled the yard like an automaton, following the same path every time.
meanings.sent3: The automatons at the boring meeting all nodded off at the same time, snoring softly.
meanings.sent4: In the busy city, people rushed past each other like automatons, lost in their own thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The repetitive tasks turned the workers into automatons, their minds on autopilot.
